entries.meaning: buoyant, tending to float on a liquid or rise in air or gas
(of a dress) lightweight, so as to rise when the wearer is walking.
Having a feeling of extreme calm, as if floating through the air.
(informal) A lilo or similar item that floats on water and can be sat on.
examples: As an escaped megalodon swims close to a busy beach, we see humanity at its most chompable: chubby kids in floaties, doofuses on pontoons, some dork in a tight Speedo rolling around in one of those big inflatable Zorb balls. But alas, the movie is a gore-free PG-13, and though CGI has long since replaced animatronics as the monster movie’s weapon of choice, one thing hasn’t changed: giant killer fish still look like they’re made of rubber.

entries.meaning: (informal) A particle of food, etc. found floating in liquid.
examples: […]  once the Oreos are gone I can't drink the milk with the floaties in it no matter how much milk is left.
